Module com.example.navalbattle
Package com.example.navalbattle.controllers

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.example.navalbattle.controllers.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
The GameController interacts with the view to place ships, initialize the player's fleet, and handle tooltips to enhance the user experience.
Author:
Mateo Noguera Pinto

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameController()
    Constructs a new GameController and initializes a ShipDrawer to handle the drawing of various ship types.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController()
      Constructs a new GameController and initializes a ShipDrawer to handle the drawing of various ship types.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(String username)
      Initializes the game by setting the player's username and checking for any previous match. If a previous match exists, it loads it; otherwise, it initializes a new match.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player

    • playerShootTurn

      private void playerShootTurn(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the player's shoot turn. Sets the player's turn flag to true and triggers turn management.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by the player

    • startButton

      private void startButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Starts the game by disabling the start button, making the fire button visible, disabling the user fleet controls, and printing the main board.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by clicking the start button

    • handlePreviousMatch

      private void handlePreviousMatch()
      Handles the case where there is a previous match in progress. Asks the player if they want to load the previous match or start a new one.

    • loadPreviousMatch

      private void loadPreviousMatch()
      Loads the previous match, sets the fleet, updates labels, and sets up events for ships and bombs.

    • initializeNewMatch

      private void initializeNewMatch()
      Initializes a new match by setting up the game model and configuring the game events.

    • updateLabels

      public void updateLabels()
      Updates the counters for the number of each ship type (frigates, destroyers, submarines, aircraft).

    • setCellsEvents

      private void setCellsEvents()
      Sets up event handlers for clicking on cells to place ships or change ship orientation. Also sets up events for the machine's fleet cells to allow shooting.

    • setBombs

      private void setBombs()
      Updates the board with bombs and shots, drawing missed shots, bombs, and fires based on the shot grids.

    • setGhostShips

      private void setGhostShips()
      Sets up the ghost ships (invisible ships used for previewing placement) for each ship type in the game. The ships are drawn but not placed on the board.

    • setUpShipEvents

      private void setUpShipEvents()
      Sets up events for ship types that allow users to select and place them on the board. Displays a description of the selected ship.

    • setSampleShips

      private void setSampleShips(javafx.scene.Group ship1, javafx.scene.Group ship2, javafx.scene.Group ship3, javafx.scene.Group ship4)
      Adds sample ships to the ship selection grid for the user to choose from.
      Parameters:
      ship1 - The first ship to add to the selection grid.
      ship2 - The second ship to add to the selection grid.
      ship3 - The third ship to add to the selection grid.
      ship4 - The fourth ship to add to the selection grid.

    • setFleet

      private void setFleet(boolean machine)
      Places the fleet on the board using the coordinates from either the machine's or player's fleet.
      Parameters:
      machine - Boolean indicating whether the fleet is for the machine (true) or the player (false).

    • updateCounter

      private void updateCounter(int shipType)
      Updates the ship counter on the UI when a ship is placed on the board. Decreases the count for the specified ship type and removes the ghost ship if there are no ships left.
      Parameters:
      shipType - The type of the ship to update (1 for Frigate, 2 for Destroyer, 3 for Submarine, 4 for Aircraft Carrier).

    • createShotHandlers

      private void createShotHandlers()
      Creates handlers for mouse events during the shot phase, including hover effects and crosshair visibility.

    • setScopePointer

      private void setScopePointer()
      This method sets some event filters to the Machine's Fleet so a cross-hair is shown on the Machine's Fleet when the user has to shoot.

    • setWinner

      private void setWinner()
      Checks if the player or machine has won the game based on the number of hits recorded on the shot grids. If either player or machine has hit all the opponent's ships, the winner is declared and the game ends.

    • turnManagement

      private void turnManagement()
      Manages the turns of the game. When it's the player's turn, the fire button is enabled and the player can shoot at the machine's fleet. When it's the machine's turn, it automatically shoots at the player's fleet after a short pause.

    • machineShoot

      private void machineShoot(int[][] playerTable, int machineShootX, int machineShootY)
      Handles the machine's shooting logic. It updates the shot grid, draws the appropriate shot, and updates the player's turn.
      Parameters:
      playerTable - The game table of the player.
      machineShootX - The x-coordinate of the shot on the table.
      machineShootY - The y-coordinate of the shot on the table.

    • playerShoot

      private void playerShoot(int[][] machineTable, javafx.scene.Node clickedNode)
      Handles the player's shooting logic. It updates the shot grid, draws the appropriate shot, and updates the player's turn.
      Parameters:
      machineTable - The game table of the machine.
      clickedNode - The clicked node (cell) on the game board.

    • drawShip

      private javafx.scene.Group drawShip(int cell, boolean vertical)
      Draws the ship corresponding to the specified type and orientation.
      Parameters:
      cell - The type of ship (1 = Frigate, 2 = Destroyer, 3 = Submarine, 4 = Aircraft Carrier).
      vertical - Determines if the ship is vertical (true) or horizontal (false).
      Returns:
      A Group object representing the ship to be added to the graphical user interface.

    • traversePositionArray

      private void traversePositionArray(int[] currentArray, boolean player)
      Traverses the position array to check the status of ships (damaged or sunk) and updates their graphical representation.
      Parameters:
      currentArray - The current ship's coordinates to be checked.
      player - Indicates whether the check is for the player (true) or machine (false).

    • checkSamePlayerShip

      private void checkSamePlayerShip()
      Checks and updates the visual representation of the player's ships after a shot is fired.

    • checkSameMachineShip

      private void checkSameMachineShip()
      Checks and updates the visual representation of the machine's ships after a shot is fired.

    • placeShip

      private void placeShip(javafx.scene.Node clickedNode)
      Places a ship on the player's board based on the selected cell and orientation.
      Parameters:
      clickedNode - The clicked node (cell) on the game board where the ship is to be placed.

    • changeOrientation

      private void changeOrientation()
      Changes the orientation of the selected ship (from horizontal to vertical or vice versa).

    • showGhostShip

      private void showGhostShip(int shipType)
      Creates a Ghost version of the ship selected that follows the pointer so the user has a preview of the ship on the grid.
      Parameters:
      shipType -

    • showMessage

      private void showMessage(String msg)
      Displays a message to the user on the interface.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to be displayed.

    • onActionRevealFleet

      private void onActionRevealFleet(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Triggered by a button click to reveal the machine's fleet when the correct keyword is entered.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the button.

    • showCustomModal

      private void showCustomModal()
      Displays a modal dialog to enter a secret keyword and reveal the machine's fleet if the correct keyword is provided.

    • setHideButton

      private void setHideButton()
      Hides the player's fleet and toggles the button to show the fleet again.

    • removeScopePointer

      private void removeScopePointer()
      This method removes all the event filters set to the Machines Fleet. This is supposed to be used when the machine has to shoot.

    • playAgain

      private void playAgain(javafx.event.Event event) throws IOException
      Resets the game by closing the current stage and opening a new one, allowing the player to play again.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by the "Play Again" button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during stage initialization.
